snippet: If and when China’s presumptive new leader, Xi Jinping, re-emerges, he will do so in the midst of a contentious Communist Party preparing to shake up its leadership.
abstract: Insiders say the Chinese political ship is adrift, with factions jockeying to shape an impending Communist Party conclave, as nation's designated new leader, Xi Jinping, has not been seen in public since Sept 1; government has maintained its official silence about his absence but a number of ranking party members agree that he has suffered either a mild heart attack or stroke.

byline.original: By IAN JOHNSON and JONATHAN ANSFIELD

lead_paragraph: If and when China’s presumptive new leader, Xi Jinping, re-emerges, he will do so in the midst of a contentious Communist Party preparing to shake up its leadership.

headline.seo: Xi Jinping’s Absence Puts Communist Party Off Script
headline.main: Off-Script Scramble for Power in a Chinese Leader’s Absence
headline.print_headline: Off-Script Scramble for Power In a Chinese Leader’s Absence
